Reason: The 'client_encryption_options' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly impacts system performance by adding overhead due to encryption/decryption processes, resource consumption for SSL contexts, and potential performance degradation depending on the encryption strength and the number of connections. The configuration involves setting up SSL/TLS encryption, initializing SSL contexts, creating SSL certificates, and handling hot reloading of certificates, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. These operations can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making the configuration performance-sensitive.
